alert.note: Alert for Yell (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 08 at 8:52PM CST until February 10 at 11:17AM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following river in Arkansas... Fourche Lafave River Near Gravelly affecting Yell County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Fourche Lafave River Near Gravelly. * WHEN...Until late Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, Portions of Highway 28 effected. Timber and pasture along West Bank floods. Property and livestock should be moved to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM CST Wednesday the stage was 26.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 27.0 feet just after midnight tonight (Feb 09). - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecast 6 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Crest Time Date Fourche Lafave R Gravelly 24.0 26.9 Wed 7 PM 12.5 6.9 5.9 27.0 12 AM 2/09 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
